intro: Ottelia benguellensis, commonly known as the African water lettuce, is a aquatic plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-like arrangement of floating, velvety leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Ottelia benguellensis thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. It is often used in ornamental ponds and wetland restoration projects due to its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
